Context Labs is seeking a Data Scientist to support the deployment of Context Labs’ Decarbonization as a Service™ platform, built on our Immutably™ Data Fabric technology. The candidate will perform research and analysis required by customer projects to deploy data-driven business products related to greenhouse gas mitigation within the energy industry. Responsibilities include the design and implementation of pipelines for ingestion, provenance, visualization, and analysis of data from a wide variety of data sources, building and testing predictive models using machine learning and advanced statistics, with a strong emphasis on the latter. This is a diverse role requiring skills from software development to applied mathematics and statistics. This role will report to the Chief Data & Analytics Officer.  Responsibilities  Performing exploratory data analysis to derive business insights Data mining using state-of-the-art methods Developing predictive models using classification and regression analysis techniques Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis Documenting requirements and resolving conflicts or ambiguities Documenting the types and structure of the business data (logical modeling) and lineage Reporting on the results of the analysis in succinct form  Skills and Qualifications  If you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.  What we are looking for:  3-5+ years of experience in a relevant data science role Master's degree required in computer science, data analytics, applied math, or similar related field. Candidates with degrees in environmental science or climate science with strong experience in data analysis would equally be considered. Outstanding applied statistics skills are highly desirable for this role Previous experience performing data analysis in oil & gas or climate science applications would be viewed favorably but not required Proven track record in data mining and predictive analytics Deep understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms Solid understanding of research design principles Strong programming skills in Python. Experience with JavaScript is a plus Broad experience with elements of Python’ data science and machine learning ecosystem including NumPy, Pandas, Jupyter, SciPy, Scikit-Learn, Statsmodels, Altair Strong communications skills to both technical and non-technical audiences. Experience with data visualization tools and frameworks such as Vega/Vega-Lite, D3.js, Plotly, Gephi, Tableau, etc. Proficiency in using SQL for data transformation and aggregation Familiarity with conceptual and logical data modeling principles  Context Labs embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our products will be. Context Labs will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please contact Erica Mackoff at HR@contextlabs.com.  Important COVID-19 Guidance:  Per Context Labs’ policy, all employees who wish to work in-office or to visit one of our offices in-person must be fully vaccinated. NCQA is hiring! We are bringing depth to our research and analysis group, and we are looking for Data Scientist who are interested in health care and health policy to add to our growing organization. The qualified candidate will conduct data analysis for various internal and external NCQA projects and using the analysis to interpret patterns of health care quality and potential health policy recommendations. The qualified candidate will derive satisfaction and joy from translating large amounts of meta data into summaries, be naturally curious and invested in data or statistical methods and have a strong communicative and collaborative interests. Responsibilities: Present analytic results orally, develop PowerPoint presentations, and other documents in writing for internal and external customers, incorporating descriptions of methods, relevant literature, and other background material to provide context for the results. Independently and effectively conducts programming tasks and statistical analysis including preparation and cleaning of data, implementation and refinement of statistical methods, preparation of formatted tables of results, creation of databases and other outputs, and verification of the accuracy of results. Participate in quality assurance processes and reviews code, outputs tables and charts. Complete all documentation and follow department standardized processes. Leads, designs, plans, and executes programming approaches to support various development projects. Can code at an expert level in applications in SAS or R, able to quickly learn other coding languages as needed. Enhance NCQA reputation for data analysis in performance measurement through presentation at NCQA’s advisory meetings, publications, and other reports as requested. Present analytic results orally and in writing to customers and other researchers incorporating descriptions of methods, relevant literature, and other background material to provide context for the results. Support NCQA’s research and performance measurement activities by investigating data and developing data design and data structures related to the project. Looks at the data from different angles, determine what the data means and recommends the best viable way to analyze it. Spots trends and patterns and determine what is noise and what is good data. In consultation with senior data scientists, support the development of analytical plans, such as database design, program design, selection of statistical methods, creation of project timelines, and development of formats for presenting results to meet customer needs. Support the preparation of memos and close out reports to contribute to knowledge management and documentation. Requirements: Master’s or Doctoral degree with experience in health services research, applied statistics, sociology, or a combination of education and experience which demonstrates the necessary skills and abilities required to succeed in data analysis. Strong programming skills in at least one of the following data coding languages - SAS, R, and SQL required. Certification a plus, knowledge of other statistical or data analysis programming languages a plus. Working with claims-based data a plus. Strong programming background, 3 years (+) experience analyzing datasets. Proficiency in statistical software packages such as SAS, SPSS, STATA or R. Profound knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications. Skilled at developing and applying univariate and multivariate modeling techniques, hypothesis testing. NCQA will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Present analytic results orally and in writing to customers and other researchers incorporating descriptions of methods, relevant literature, and other background material to provide context for the results. Support NCQA’s research and performance measurement activities by investigating data and developing data design and data structures related to the project. Looks at the data from different angles, determine what the data means and recommends the best viable way to analyze it. Spots trends and patterns and determine what is noise and what is good data. In consultation with senior data scientists, support the development of analytical plans, such as database design, program design, selection of statistical methods, creation of project timelines, and development of formats for presenting results to meet customer needs. Support the preparation of memos and close out reports to contribute to knowledge management and documentation. Requirements: Requirements: Master’s or Doctoral degree with experience in health services research, applied statistics, sociology, or a combination of education and experience which demonstrates the necessary skills and abilities required to succeed in data analysis. Strong programming skills in at least one of the following data coding languages - SAS, R, and SQL required. Certification a plus, knowledge of other statistical or data analysis programming languages a plus. Working with claims-based data a plus. Strong programming background, 3 years (+) experience analyzing datasets. Proficiency in statistical software packages such as SAS, SPSS, STATA or R. Profound knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications. Skilled at developing and applying univariate and multivariate modeling techniques, hypothesis testing. Role Summary: We are seeking an experienced Data Science Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a unique blend of technical expertise in both data engineering and data science, with a deep understanding of Azure cloud infrastructure and tools. You will play a pivotal role in developing, optimizing, and deploying machine learning models, data pipelines, and databases to facilitate the development of generative AI solutions that are scalable and integrated with existing enterprise systems. As a Data Science Engineer, you will design and manage data pipelines and databases, develop and deploy scalable ML models, and collaborate with teams to integrate AI solutions into business processes. You will utilize data classification platforms and standard ML to continuously improve model performance. Stay informed about the latest in AI/ML advancements. Responsibilities: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines for sourcing, cleaning, and preprocessing data for machine learning models. Develop, test, and deploy scalable machine learning models using Azure cloud infrastructure and tools. Perform cross-validation to assess model performance on unseen data. Engage in feature engineering to improve data input quality. Update models periodically with fresh data to capture new patterns. Implement reinforcement learning techniques for dynamic model adjustments using feedback. Monitor and analyze model outcomes, identifying areas for further refinement. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning solutions into business processes. Ensure efficient cloud resource utilization, optimizing cost and performance. Leverage data labeling tools to manage datasets for supervised learning tasks. Continuously enhance model performance and data quality through monitoring and validation. Stay current with AI/ML advancements. Requirements: Strong proficiency in Python, with expertise in TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, NumPy, and Pandas. Solid experience in Azure cloud infrastructure, including Azure ML, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Databricks. Proficiency in SQL, NoSQL, and vector databases. Experience with Huggingface and Langchain. Proven track record of developing and deploying machine learning models in a real-world environment. Understanding of data warehousing, integration, cloud deployment, scalability, security, and backup strategies, including vector databases (e.g., Faiss, Pinecone, Milvus) for AI tasks. Strong analytical skills to derive actionable insights from complex data structures. Excellent problem-solving abilities with a focus on pragmatism and scalability. Bachelor’s/master’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field; significant work experience and a strong portfolio also considered. Preferred Experience / Skills: Familiarity with data labeling tools and platforms. More details: We are seeking candidates who do not currently require or anticipate requiring sponsorship to work in the United States in the present or future (e.g., H-1B, H-2B, F-1, F-2, J-1, J-2, TN, etc.). Benefits: Flowserve offers highly competitive pay, annual bonus, comprehensive benefits on day 1 of employment, generous paid vacation time, paid holidays, pension plan, 401(k) and many other excellent benefits Req ID : R-6921 Job Family Group : Information Technology Job Family : IT Business Analysis EOE including Disability/Protected Veterans. Flowserve will also not discriminate against an applicant or employee for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing their pay or, in certain circumstances, the pay of their co-workers. You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an email to employment@flowserve.com. In order to quickly respond to your request, please use the words "Accommodation Request" as your subject line of your email. For more information, read the Accessibility Process. Job Title: Data Scientist 3 Job Title: Job Location: Richmond, VA 23219 (Hybrid) Job Location: Job Duration: 6+ Months contract with the possibility of extending Job Duration: Job Summary Job Summary The Data Scientist will be responsible for gathering and analyzing large sets of structured and unstructured data. They will analyze, process, and model data then interpret the results to create actionable plans for DHRM and its customers. The individual in this role will utilize scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from structured and unstructured data, and apply knowledge and actionable insights from data across a broad range of application domains. The employee will need to understand how to create and manipulate large data sets and use data normalization and cleansing tools to meet the needs of DHRM customers. To ensure adoption by the business, this position will be required to ensure the quality of each dashboard release, data refresh, and adhere to a regular refresh and dashboard publishing schedule. Roles & Responsibilities Roles & Responsibilities · Refresh analysis data on a regular basis and publish new dashboards. · Work with, establish working relationships, and develop a strong working knowledge of DHRM business processes, strategic vision, and overall mission. · Ensure data accuracy by quality checking each analysis prior to publishing. · Build new data visualizations to demonstrate business performance and uncover opportunity. · Participate in business/IT projects that will enhance the quality of the data to be used in the visualization tool and ensure data sets utilize core data wherever possible. · Compile and analyze data from a variety of applications, systems, and sources to create/summarize for analysis. · Conducting deep dive analyses with data stewards and business subject matter experts or developing new data sources and analytical models to identify opportunities to drive value & innovation in HR. Job Type: Contract Salary: Up to $51.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift 8 hour shift Ability to commute/relocate: Richmond, VA 23219: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Richmond, VA 23219: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Experience: Python: 5 years (Preferred) SQL: 5 years (Preferred) Data science: 5 years (Preferred) Machine learning: 5 years (Preferred) Python: 5 years (Preferred) SQL: 5 years (Preferred) Data science: 5 years (Preferred) Machine learning: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: In person

Data Scientist Basic Qualifications  Current, active TS/SCI security clearance with Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI)  Bachelor of Science (BSc) in a STEM-related discipline plus 10 years of relevant experience, OR a successfully completed post-graduate degree program from an accredited institution of higher learning in a STEM-related discipline plus five years of relevant experience.  Demonstrated mastery and employment of geographic and geospatial scientific principles, tools, and analytical techniques, to be reflected throughout the majority of relevant prior experience.  Demonstrated experience and proficiency with data science techniques including (but not limited to) logistic regression, vector, natural language processing, principal component analysis, clustering techniques, neural networks, deep learning models, image recognition and algorithm employment or development in support of any of the foregoing.  Demonstrated experience and proficiency with tabular analysis, SQL, and scripting languages (e.g., Python, R, Julia, etc.) to deliver unique insights otherwise unobtainable.  Familiarity with agile software development project management frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban, Lean, etc.) to deliver new capability.  Demonstrated experience employing a diverse set of structured analytical methods against complex problems (e.g., quality of information, risk assessment, analysis of competing hypotheses, mind maps, link analysis, high-impact/low-probability analysis, alternative futures, etc.). Preferred Qualifications  Experience working with IT, business, or operational metrics platforms (e.g., Splunk, Elastic, Confluence, etc.)  Certification in AWS (AI/ML specialty).  Knowledge of the National System for Geospatial-Intelligence (NSG) tasking, collection, processing, exploitation and dissemination (TCPED) production chain.  Experience working within a DoD or Intelligence Community (IC) operational environment and with DoD/IC geospatial data repositories.  Familiarity with Army, DoD or IC GEOINT or Geospatial processes, policy and programs.  Experience with Microsoft Office tools to deliver reports, graphics and briefings. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $130,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Relocation assistance Vision insurance 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Relocation assistance Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift 8 hour shift Supplemental pay types: Bonus pay Bonus pay Ability to commute/relocate: Fort Gordon, GA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Fort Gordon, GA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Security clearance: Top Secret (Required) Top Secret (Required) Work Location: In person

The Bay Area Environmental Research (BAER) Institute, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization focused on enabling and conducting research in Earth and space science, is seeking a Data Scientist for the NASA Ames Earth Science Division with experience in the areas of satellite remote sensing and advanced data analytics including This position will work with the NASA Earth Exchange (NEX; https://nasa.gov/nex) at NASA Ames Research Center. NEX combines state-of-the-art supercomputing, Earth system modeling, and NASA remote sensing data feeds to deliver a work environment for exploring and analyzing terabyte- to petabyte-scale datasets covering large regions. This position is located at NASA’s Ames Research Center (ARC), Moffett Field, CA, and is initially for 4 years with the possibility of extension. Telework and remote work may be available and must comport with the position requirements. Job Description Will be a member of the Global Business Intelligence team in a role spanning both Data Science and Data Architect functions - working with BI developers/business analysts as well as business teams to determine analysis opportunities using a variety of data types (structured, unstructured) and sources (internal enterprise Data Warehouse, public cloud and external SaaS). Partner and collaborate with other IST and business teams in strategic projects including Project ONE (replatform of applications to Salesforce.com) to innovate around analytics, identifying new sources of data, and overall project strategy support. Translating business needs into an efficient and effective analysis plan, performing and managing execution of analysis, and translating findings into insight in an effort to ensure adoption and business integration. Will apply data science techniques to explore data, develop analysis to support strategies that help lines of business. The ideal candidate will be curious to explore data, always asking why related to patterns identified. The candidate should have aptitude to quickly evaluate new technologies to help continue the evolution of the future cloud first data platform.  SPECIFIC SKILL SETS REQUIREMENTS: 3+ years of hands-on experience performing advanced analytics across the following broad skillset Knowledge and experience in statistical and machine learning techniques such as K-means clustering, General Linear Model, Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau (Desktop/Prep/Server) and Salesforce.com CRM Analytics (formerly Einstein Analytics) Experience analyzing and integrating data from 3rd party systems, specifically Salesforce.com (Spanning most clouds including Marketing, Commerce, Service, Experience) and Google Analytics (GA4 and BigQuery) Experience with AWS analytics services and related technologies such as EMR, S3, Athena, Glue, Lambda, SQS, Redshift Experience in open source programming languages such as Python and Spark for large scale data analysis Experience contributing to cloud infrastructure automation builds using Terraform Experience deploying machine-learning techniques on an enterprise-scale, specifically using both Python and Salesforce.com Einstein Discovery Data wrangling proficiency in handling imperfections in data and combining across a variety of sources both global and hybrid in nature Strong experience with writing complex SQL queries Strong understanding of relational and dimensional data models Strong proven written and oral communication skills including the ability to convey complex issues to executive level leaders in a non-technical manner Strong business acumen and ability to translate data patterns to business processes Ability to move data around from a database or an API, through transformations, a model and into readable or visual form Ability to blend quantitative and analytical skills, problem solving and strategy consulting with a strong bias to action Team player with emphasis on knowledge sharing and demonstrated ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously  SPECIFIC SKILL SETS DESIRED, BUT NOT NECESSARILY REQUIRED: Any other analytics related technology experience Experience in the Direct Selling industry Experience with other cloud analytics offerings such as Snowflake or Databricks EDUCATION REQUIRED OR DESIRED: Degree in Computer Science/MIS with Masters or equivalent in data science, math, economics, statistics or related field FOREIGN LANGUAGE(S) REQUIRED OR DESIRED: Ability to speak a foreign language such as Spanish, Portuguese, Chinese or Russian may be helpful but not required.  TRAVEL: Possibly to international subsidiaries, but should not exceed 2 weeks per year.  To save time applying, Mary Kay Inc does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.  Company Overview Looking for a career where you can make a difference? At Mary Kay we are committed to enriching the lives of women and their families around the world, we offer careers with unlimited opportunities to do something beautiful every day. More than 5,000 employees work in locations around the world. They provide the products, marketing and other support to millions of Independent Beauty Consultants (IBCs) who work as independent contractors, selling our products directly to consumers in nearly 40 markets on five continents. We are a company that believes in our people and cares for them with truly exceptional benefits. We offer: A comprehensive health plan which includes medical, dental, and vision with low premiums 401(k) plan A generous profit-sharing program Free access to on-site fitness center and on-site clinic #LI-Hybrid Job Description Job Description - working with BI developers/business analysts as well as business teams to determine analysis opportunities using a variety of data types (structured, unstructured) and sources (internal enterprise Data Warehouse, public cloud and external SaaS). Partner and collaborate with other IST and business teams in strategic projects including Project ONE (replatform of applications to Salesforce.com) to innovate around analytics, identifying new sources of data, and overall project strategy support. Translating business needs into an efficient and effective analysis plan, performing and managing execution of analysis, and translating findings into insight in an effort to ensure adoption and business integration. Will apply data science techniques to explore data, develop analysis to support strategies that help lines of business. The ideal candidate will be curious to explore data, always asking why related to patterns identified. The candidate should have aptitude to quickly evaluate new technologies to help continue the evolution of the future cloud first data platform. - working with BI developers/business analysts as well as business teams to determine analysis opportunities using a variety of data types (structured, unstructured) and sources (internal enterprise Data Warehouse, public cloud and external SaaS). Job Description As a Data Scientist, you will help healthcare run efficiently through AI models that improve the distribution and manufacturing of healthcare products. You will understand key problems faced by business partners across the business, and ask good questions. You will brainstorm possible statistical solutions with help from Senior Data Scientists. You will own AI experiments, failing fast and pivot to the right solution. Finally, you will operationalize models with help from Senior Machine Learning Engineers. Responsibilities Extract data from multiple data sources like Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Azure Blob, and Azure SQL using SQL or Python Interpret data well and study patterns using Python libraries like Pandas, Seaborn, and Matplotlib Present findings in clean analysis and visualization to stakeholders Present findings in Tableau in a way that compels and enables decision-makers. Conduct machine learning experiments using libraries like scikitlearn, tensorflow or spark mllib Package models to be consumed in enterprise setting through APIs Test and troubleshoot production models as needed Help with production release, migration testing, etc. as needed Perform basic Image and Spectral data processing for data preparation Build standalone and integration ready modules and packages for solution Qualifications Self-starter with good communication skills Proficient in Python – Pandas, Seaborn and Matplotlib Skilled in Tableau Visualization Excellent knowledge of SQL ( Handling Nulls, Joins, Unions, Case, Date Time Manipulation, String Formatting) Good knowledge in Excel based data analysis (Graphs, Charts, Pivots, Lookups and Statistical Functions) Knowledge of Scikitlearn, Tensor flow, or Spark mllib Must be able to demonstrate skills through any public channel like GitHub , own website/blog, or Tableau Public Knowledge of structured, unstructured and other data formats/sources Skilled in building basic RESTful APIs and documentation Over 2 years of experience as Data Scientist Over 3 years of experience as BI/Data Analyst Over 3 years of experience with Python, SQL and Tableau SEND US YOUR RESUME AT CAREERS@NUTANXT.COM Job Description As a Data Scientist, you will help healthcare run efficiently through AI models that improve the distribution and manufacturing of healthcare products. Work Mode: Onsite Responsibilities: Description: Are you eager to help both build a team from scratch and produce a game that’ll have a global impact?  We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our new AAA team, Uncapped Games in Los Angeles. The ideal candidate for this role will help innovate an all-new and original IP to revolutionize RTS games for players around the world.  Perks:  Full remote work options are available based on project needs  Highly creative and collaborative start-up culture  Competitive pay and benefits What You’ll Get to Do: Work with large-scale datasets and solve complex business and technical problems through analytics, modeling, and experimentation Interact cross-functionally with various teams and provide actionable business insights to stakeholders Conduct applied research and develop data solutions in machine learning, optimization, experimentation, and causal inference to solve business problems and create user value Explore project opportunities broadly with an open mindset and leverage various data science methods flexibly Contribute to data science best practices, process, training, and sharing, to build data science culture and technical advances Create dashboards, presenting data clearly through digestible means for team management so smart decisions for the game can be made Requirements: What We Are Looking For: M.S., or Ph.D. candidate in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or equivalent practical experience Familiar with data science methods such as data analysis and visualization, experimentation, causal inference, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, time series, probabilities and sampling methods Experienced in SQL and proficient in Python or one of other higher-level programming languages Passionate about making impact, learning new technology, and conducting applied research to solve challenging problems AAA and free to play game experience Pluses: A passion for RTS games, bringing to the table an understanding of what makes them work well as a genre Able to work effectively with all game development disciplines Experience seeing multiple titles to completion, starting all the way from the pre-production phase to post launch data support  Location State(s) California The base pay range for this position in the state(s) above is $89,650 to $242,000 per year. Actual pay is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign on payment, relocation package, and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, as well as other medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the specific position offered. Overview: VTG is seeking a Data Scientist.  This position is contingent upon contract award. Responsibilities: Data Scientists develop and implement a set of techniques or analytics applications to transform raw data into meaningful information using data-oriented programming languages and visualization software.  Apply data mining, data modeling, natural language processing, and machine learning to extract and analyze information from large structured and unstructured datasets. Visualize, interpret, and report data findings. Create dynamic data reports. Qualifications: Education Bachelors Degree. Experience Minimum of 7 years related experience in Data Science. VTG’s estimated starting pay range is $105,000/yr - $167,000 , which is a general guideline for the geographic location. When extending an offer, VTG also considers work experience, education, skill level, market considerations and may possibly include contractual requirements which may cause an offer to fall outside of this range. Machine Learning Engineer Machine Learning Engineer Description: Description: Clostra is a growing artificial Intelligence (AI) company looking to expand by adding several machine learning engineers to our team. We use state-of-the-art machine learning to create innovative solutions for our U.S. government partners. Clostra is a fully remote/work-from-home company. Since we offer remote work positions, qualified candidates from across the United States are encouraged to apply. Our engineers work to solve our customers’ problems by extracting maximum value from a myriad of interesting datasets. At Clostra, you would have the opportunity to work with other talented engineers through all phases of a solution lifecycle, from initial customer engagement to solution prototyping and follow on activities. The ideal candidate will be passionate about artificial intelligence / machine learning, demonstrate the individual drive to work through challenging problems, collaborate as part of a distributed team and be willing to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the field. Responsibilities: Responsibilities: Design machine learning systems Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools Develop applications that integrate machine learning solutions Select relevant datasets and data representation methods Verify data quality and/or ensuring it via data cleaning Find available datasets online which could be used for training Run machine learning tests and experiments Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results Train and retrain systems when necessary Design machine learning systems Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools Develop applications that integrate machine learning solutions Select relevant datasets and data representation methods Verify data quality and/or ensuring it via data cleaning Find available datasets online which could be used for training Run machine learning tests and experiments Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results Train and retrain systems when necessary Required Skills: Required Skills: Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture Ability to write robust code in Python, Java, and R Must be highly proficient in Python, C++ programming languages Must have excellent mathematical skills in areas such as statistics, linear algebra, probability theory, and calculus Should be able to communicate the results of your work clearly to other team members in a disaggregated work environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture Ability to write robust code in Python, Java, and R Must be highly proficient in Python, C++ programming languages Must have excellent mathematical skills in areas such as statistics, linear algebra, probability theory, and calculus Should be able to communicate the results of your work clearly to other team members in a disaggregated work environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Candidates must live and work in the United States and be able to obtain a US Security Clearance. AG Grace is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. The Data Scientist will establish and implement mathematical problem-solving, and coding skills to manage a wide variety of data and extract valuable insights. Data will involve structured and unstructured data from information advantage activities in support of multi-domain operations. Work is performed in a hybrid role with some on-site customer support.  Essential Job Responsibilities The data scientist will utilize their expertise in machine learning, statistical data analytics, and predictive analytics to help create and implement data solutions and analytics for diverse Department of Defense (DoD) data sets. Responsible for the creation of innovative methodologies for extracting key parameters from structured and unstructured data coming from various sensors. Capable of applying the latest technologies in machine learning, data mining, and predictive analytics to correlate disparate datasets and events, and derive value. Experience in data mining, natural language processing, and sentiment analysis of social media datasets. Performs project assignments characterized as highly unstructured and complex, having little definition or clarity. Systematically design analytical approaches to organizing research into segments and coordinating input from other sources such as subject matter experts from the problem's substantive area. Defines the nature of the problem or clarifies issues through extensive coordination, research, and data collection. AG Grace is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. The Data Scientist will establish and implement mathematical problem-solving, and coding skills to manage a wide variety of data and extract valuable insights. Data will involve structured and unstructured data from information advantage activities in support of multi-domain operations. Work is performed in a hybrid role with some on-site customer support. Capable of applying the latest technologies in machine learning, data mining, and predictive analytics to correlate disparate datasets and events, and derive value. Stand Together is a dynamic and mission-driven organization committed to driving positive social change and empowering individuals to overcome barriers. Join our team and be part of a collaborative community that values innovation, personal responsibility, and the power of bottom-up solutions. Together, we will create a society that fosters opportunity, dignity, and well-being for all.  Stand Together is looking for a Marketing Data Scientist, your mission will be to harness the power of data to drive our marketing initiatives and content strategy. You will navigate the intricate landscape of data, leveraging your data skills and analytical prowess to curate new and evolve existing analytical data sets integral to our business. You will uncover insights, identify trends, and assist our team in answering key questions to inform our marketing strategies and key decisions. You’ll help us answer the toughest questions through data mining, integration, and reshaping of data to make it usable for sharing key insights that support our key initiatives. Your Responsibilities Include Manage and maintain our key data assets to ensure they contain the latest and most accurate data needed to support our analytic and marketing activities. Work with current and new tools and other teams to establish, automate, and evolve subject data sets used for analysis and reporting. Utilize data tools and advanced analysis techniques to create, reshape, integrate, and validate data needed to answer key questions and support measurement of our key projects and initiatives through data. Analyze data from multiple sources to develop comprehensive understanding of user behavior and content performance to make recommendations that optimize marketing efforts. Break down complex questions into actionable steps, use data to conduct advanced analysis and share results and recommendations with key stakeholders. Collaborate with other analysts and marketing teams to implement data-driven measurement solutions, ensuring our campaigns and content hit the mark every time. Build and maintain new dashboards and related analysis built using Tableau Develop models to improve content and marketing activities where needed. Present complex data in a clear and understandable manner to non-data professionals. Knowledge and Skills You Bring to the Organization Proven experience as a Data Scientist and/or BI Data Engineer, preferably within the marketing or content space. Proficient in data analytics and machine learning tools (Tableau Prep, R, Python, SQL, etc). Solid proficiency with the following tools: (Tableau Desktop, Tableau Prep, Snowflake, Funnel.io, Google Analytics, Iterable, and Sprinklr) but able to quickly learn others. Experience performing analytics around following topics: Email Analytics, Web Analytics, Social Analytics, Customer Analytics, Content Analytics, Predictive Analytics, machine learning, etc… and familiar with the differing data structures, metadata, and challenges each present. Solid data experience in cleaning, re-shaping, and integrating larger multi-channel data sets, applying statistical techniques, and providing insights to drive business decisions. Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into easily digestible content. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. What We Offer A meaningful career where your work will improve the lives of millions of Americans – especially the least fortunate. A vision-driven organization of over 1,000 employees across the country who are dedicated to improving the lives of others. Competitive salaries and bonuses. Our salary and bonus strategies are aligned to the value you create, not a standardized bell curve. Generous 401K match - 6% match with immediate vesting. Competitive health and wellness benefits. Our flexible time-off policy allows all employees to take leave as needed. Commuter assistance plans to offset the cost of commuting into our headquarters (on-site parking or metro). Opportunities for professional development and mentorship that can strengthen your effectiveness through Principle Based Management and other industry specific programs. Stand Together helps social entrepreneurs supercharge their efforts to help people improve their lives. We connect them with passionate partners and the resources necessary to make a greater difference. Through our philanthropic community, we tackle some of the nation's biggest challenges so that every person has the opportunity to realize their extraordinary potential. Stand Together partners with people from diverse perspectives and backgrounds—including people in education, business, community non-profits, and public policy—to accomplish more together than any of us could on our own. Our Values Working at Stand Together is different from many other organizations. We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management® (PBM®). Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM® prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees. We believe that diversity in experiences, perspectives, knowledge and ideas fuels creativity, broadens knowledge, and helps drive success. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and strive to treat all employees and applicants with honesty, dignity, respect and sensitivity. We welcome all qualified applicants regardless of color, race, religion, religious creed, sex, gender or gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, ethnicity, ancestry, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy (including medical needs which may arise from pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), military and veteran status, genetic information, marital or familial status, political affiliation, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. At AMERICAN, the Data Scientist is responsible for extracting actionable insights from complex and large-scale data sets, driving data-driven decision-making processes, and developing innovative solutions to solve business problems as well as machine learning modeling, management and problem analysis, data exploration and preparation, and data collection and integration. This position plays a pivotal role in planning, executing, and delivering machine learning-based projects. The Data Scientist works closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, design experiments, build predictive models, and provide data-driven recommendations to optimize business strategies. Performs data exploration, cleansing, and preprocessing tasks on diverse and large-scale data sets to ensure data quality. Develops and implements statistical models, algorithms, and machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights and patterns from data. Collaborates with stakeholders to identify business challenges, define objectives, and design experiments and analysis plans to address them. Applies advanced statistical techniques and hypothesis testing to analyze experimental and observational data, and provide actionable recommendations based on the findings. Conducts data mining and exploratory analysis to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies, and communicate the insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaborates with Application Architects and Systems Architects to integrate models and algorithms into production systems and ensure scalability and reliability. Stays up to date with the latest industry trends, techniques, and tools in data science, and proactively apply them to enhance the data analysis and modeling processes. Presents findings, results, and recommendations to internal teams and stakeholders through reports, visualizations, and presentations. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain data pipelines, data architecture, and data infrastructure for efficient data collection, storage, retrieval, and reporting. Applies various ML and advanced analytics techniques to perform diverse classification or prediction tasks. Guides the organization on business potential and strategy of AI/data science. Applies statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various data, such as hierarchical clustering, T-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE), and principal components analysis (PCA). Networks with domain experts to better understand the business mechanics that generate data. Generates hypotheses about underlying mechanics of business processes. Tests hypotheses using various quantitative methods. Keeps work area clean and orderly. Knows safety rules that apply to the safety of others and to personal safety. Reports malfunction of equipment to proper authority. Performs other work as instructed by supervision. Minimum Qualifications: Must exhibit a bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or Information Systems, or an equivalent degree from an accredited four-year college or university. Proof of degree required. A transcript or diploma would be acceptable and must be provided. Must exhibit knowledge of one or more Artificial Intelligence coding languages. Must exhibit the ability to learn various database programming languages for relational databases. Must exhibit excellent problem-solving skills. Must exhibit exceptional technical writing skills. Must exhibit excellent attention to detail. Must exhibit good oral and written communication skills (i.e., good command of grammar and spelling). Must exhibit good time management skills. Must exhibit good interpersonal skills. Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar. Exhibit extensive experience in statistical analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and programming. Coding knowledge and experience in R, Lisp, Python/Jupyter, SAS, Java, Scala, C++, Excel, and MATLAB. Experience with distributed data/computing tools such as MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Kafka, and MySQL. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques such as generalized linear models (GLM)/regression, random forest, boosting, trees, text mining, hierarchical clustering, deep learning, convolutional neural network (CNN), recurrent neural network (RNN), T-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE), and graph analysis. Title: Data Scientist (Oil & Gas Hydraulics) Title: Data Scientist (Oil & Gas Hydraulics) Location: Houston, TX (Hybrid position – 3 days onsite and 2 days remote) Location: Houston, TX (Hybrid position – 3 days onsite and 2 days remote) Duration: Long term Duration: Long term We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist with experience in building optimization and machine learning models specifically for oil and gas hydraulics use cases. As a Data Scientist, you will play a critical role in analysing and improving hydraulics processes within the oil and gas industry. Your expertise in data science and machine learning will be instrumental in driving operational efficiency and cost optimization. Responsibilities: Responsibilities Develop and implement optimization and machine learning models to improve hydraulics processes in the oil and gas industry. Analyse and interpret data related to target flow rates, energy/utility costs, pump efficiency curves, Drag Reducing Agent (DRA) performance curves, DRA QA limits, DRA costs, and pipeline attributes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and apply data-driven solutions. Conduct thorough data analysis, feature engineering, and model development to extract actionable insights. Utilize advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to predict and optimize hydraulics performance. Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and optimization methodologies relevant to the oil and gas industry. Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders, including technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborate with data engineers and IT teams to ensure seamless data integration and model deployment. Requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Petroleum Engineering, or related disciplines). Proven experience in building optimization and machine learning models for oil and gas hydraulics use cases. Strong familiarity with concepts such as target flow rates, energy/utility costs, pump efficiency curves, DRA performance curves, DRA QA limits, DRA costs, and pipeline attributes. Proficiency in data science tools and programming languages, including Python, R, PySpark, DASK, and SQL. Solid understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and optimization techniques. Experience in data manipulation, cleansing, and feature engineering. Ability to work with large datasets and perform exploratory data analysis. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions. Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey complex findings and recommendations to stakeholders. About BHI: BHI is a data and analytics company and helping health plans, researchers, healthcare providers, employers, and government agencies use data to improve the health outcomes, promote value-based care, and address health equity and increase the value of care provided. We leverage the industry’s most comprehensive and highest quality commercial data assets combined with advanced analytics, AI/ML, and deep healthcare expertise to collaborate with our customers to produce measurable outcomes and value. Based on our continuing growth, and the increasing value our team is producing in partnership with our customers, we are growing our data engineering team and are looking for someone to lead this effort with us. Position Summary Working with the nation’s largest health care database, Blue Health Intelligence (BHI) provides analytic solutions for Blue Cross Blue Shield plans across the country. BHI’s data science team designs state of the art solutions through advanced methodologies, models, and measures. Advanced methodologies are a key differentiator for BHI’s product and analytical solutions. The incumbent will contribute to the design and development of robust analytics with practical business impact, working closely with senior analysts in a cooperative team environment. As a Data Scientist, this role will be responsible for the development of BHI’s advanced technologies particularly to do with statistical score modeling, model development, score/model deployment, large scale database analysis and statistical algorithms. The Data Scientist is responsible for participating in the full array of predictive modeling activities at BHI, either independently or under the leadership of a Data Scientist. Conduct quantitative analyses, co-author study reports, and create innovative analytic approaches. The position will also serve as a content expert in statistical modeling techniques applied to large claims databases. Accountable for the execution of advanced analytic models, and will be responsible for technical review of research, synthesis, and dissemination of results to enable innovative products.  Job Responsibilities Analyze complex health care data to provide meaningful results and enriched analytics Contribute to the design of new analytic components for existing BHI engagements and product offerings and participate in the develop of new products and solutions. Coordinate the development of standard definitions of measures to be used as predictors and targets in predictive model development. Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data that helps generate insights and addresses reporting needs Explores, examines and interprets large volumes of data in various forms Performs analyses of structured and unstructured data to solve moderately complex business problems Uses data visualization techniques to effectively communicate analytical results and support business decisions. Coordinate with the development team to ensure an efficient structure for analytic measures and model assets. Develop a clear process for measure development, from business need, through specification and documentation. Participate in team development of efficient queries and models in a complex multi-million-member database. Assist senior analysts in evaluating results to confirm accuracy, efficiency, and compliance with client requirements. Work with senior analysts to develop statistical models using statistical tools and techniques which include, but are not limited to, logistic regression, clustering, survival analysis, and multilevel models. Meet all data privacy rules and ensure all work is compliant with data handling standards. Meet all business requirements and deadlines and communicate progress and challenges encountered to team leads. Present results in a clear and professional manner to members of the BHI team. Provide analytics and consultative support to internal customers and peers. As part of the analytical unit of the company the incumbent will assist with analytical questions from other teams within BHI in a collaborative manner, particularly development and clinical teams.  Job Requirements Master’s degree or doctorate in health care informatics, epidemiology, statistics, econometrics, or actuarial sciences. 4+ years of analytical programming experience with an emphasis on SQL, Python, and Data Robot. Experience with analytic database design and application Demonstrated ability to communicate analytic recommendations to a non-technical audience in a clear and concise manner. Knowledge of advanced analytics tools and languages to analyze large data sets from multiple data sources. Demonstrated ability to evaluate and interpret complex data sets. Demonstrated analysis and problem-solving skills. Ability to work both independently and as part of a project team. Rigorous and thorough approach. Is familiar with SOC 2 compliance and its impact on company policies and processes Understands importance of adhering to SOC 2 requirements, and maintains an effort to do so  Preferred Qualifications 4+ years of experience with large health care claims databases. Experience with a health insurance plan, healthcare analytics organization, healthcare consultancy, or provider organization. Predictive modeling experience. Ability to proactively initiate process improvement discussions.
